p: On day 12, the temperature of the patient returned to normal. The symptoms of the patient alleviated completely, and the result of the CT scan on day 15 was also back to normal (Fig. 2). We consistently tested the RT-PCR for COVID-19 on day 19, day 25, and day 31 to 34, but all the results remained positive. The RT-PCR for COVID-19 turned negative for the first time on the day 35. Meantime, the IgM antibody for SARS-CoV-2 on day 35 was positive. Then we tested the RT-PCR and IgM for SARS-CoV-2 every 3 days. The RT-PCR for SARS-CoV-2 remained negative, while the IgM antibody for SARS-CoV-2 turned negative on day 44. We confirmed the viral clearance, and the patient was discharged on day 47.
